short_description: From the bustling city of Kuala Lumpur to the pristine rainforests of Borneo, Malaysia is a land of contrasts. Explore its diverse cultures, sample its delicious cuisine, and soak up the natural beauty of this incredible country

alcohol_info: Anyone caught selling to persons under 21 can be fined up to RM10,000 and jailed up to 2 years
Malaysian identity cards include a designation of religion, which allows enforcement of the religion-based sales restriction

tipping.hotels: Tipping is not required or expected as service charge covers this. If you want to tip, aim for RM 2-10 per staff member
tipping.guides: A private tour guide should receive RM 20 - 30 per day, per person. Group tours don't need a tip but you can offer 10% as a gesture
tipping.restaurants: Tipping is not required as a 10% service charge is usually added to the bill
tipping.taxis: Tipping taxi drivers is not required. If you hire a driver for a few days, tip RM 25-50

weather.title: Malaysia has a tropical climate with high temperatures and humidity year-round. It experiences a wet season from October to March, with heavy rainfall, and a drier season from April to September. The country is known for its lush rainforests and diverse wildlife

when_to_visit.title: Best for Peninsular Malaysia
when_to_visit.short_description: Less rainfall and lower humidity, offering perfect weather for outdoor activities and popular destinations like Kuala Lumpur, Malacca, and Penang. Rain showers can still happen year-round but are typically short

when_to_visit.title: Best for Borneo
when_to_visit.short_description: Clear skies and optimal conditions for exploring lush rainforests, wildlife reserves and the iconic Mount Kinabalu. Note there is a risk of rainfall on Borneo all year round, including main states Sabah and Sarawak

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Malaysia depends on the region, but generally, the months of March to October offer good weather conditions, lower chances of rainfall, and pleasant temperatures for exploring the country's diverse landscapes
